trial_identification.studytitle: Influence of trunk control on the manual function of children with myelomeningocele.
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Assessment of trunk control on manual function in children with myelomeningocele using the In Hand Manipulation and Trunk Impairment Scale.

interventions.interventions: In this study the intervention group is composed with children who have myelomeningocele and control group with healthy children. We apply a subitem fine motor function of Epilepsis Barn Test and a range of performance in specific activities In-Hand Manipulation, who assesses the hand function; and a Trunk Impairment Scale, who assesses the trunk function in this children. This tests, is completed in a 1/2 hour session; each participant undergoes each test once only during a single session; this tests administered individually by a physiotherapist.
interventions.comparator: The control group, composed for healthy children without myelomeningocele, receive the same treatment and the results will be compared

primaryOutcome.outcome: mean subitem fine motor function Epilepsis Barn Test score, who assesses fine motor movements of the hand.
mean In-Hand Manipulation score, who assesses ability of manipulate objects
mean Trunk Impairment Scale score, who assesses trunk motor function

secondaryOutcome.outcome: time taken to complete hand manupulation task

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: The study group is composed with children who have myelomeningocele, on the other hand, the control group is composed with health children.
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: cognitive impairment interfering with comprehension tests muscle-skeletal deformities impaired vision and / or hearing that might have prevented their implementation.

secondarysponsor.sponsorname: Ambulatorio de Fisioterapia Aplicada a Neurologia Infantil HC-UNICAMP
secondarysponsor.sponsoraddress: Rua Vital Brasil, 251 Cidade Universitaria Zeferino Vaz Campinas - SP CEP 13083-887

ethicsAndSummary.summary: This study have intention the correlate postural control and manual function in healthy children versus children with myelomeningocele

ethicscommitee.ethicname: Comite de Etica e Pesquisa da Faculdade de Ciencias Medicas da Universidade Estadual de Campinas
